key_mistakes.reason: Missed opportunity to control the center with c4, which supports d4 and challenges the d5 pawn.
Developed the knight to a less effective square, missing the opportunity to reinforce the center and create threats.
Exposed the queen to potential attacks, losing tempo and coordination.
Allowed Black to gain a tempo and develop further. It also left the queen vulnerable.
Failed to address the threats on the queenside and allowed Black to stabilize the position.

recommendations: Consider controlling the center with c4 early in the game to support d4.
Keep the queen safe and ensure it does not get exposed to attacks without support.
Focus on developing pieces to optimal squares to maintain flexibility and control.
Avoid unnecessary moves that lose tempo and allow the opponent to strengthen their position.
